Package es.utils.functionalinterfaces.throwing

Provides a set of utility classes useful in the implementation.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ConsumerX<T>
    A sub-class of Consumer that handle the exceptions.
    FunctionX<T,U>  
    PredicateX<T>  
    SupplierX<T>  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ExceptionHandle
    This class can be use to simply catch the exception of a Function or a Consumer such that you does not have to explicitly do a try-catch inside an Stream or Optional operation.

Package es.utils.functionalinterfaces.throwing Description

Provides a set of utility classes useful in the implementation.
The package contains the following class:
  • ExceptionHandle
  • ConsumerX
  • FunctionX
  • PredicateX
  • SupplierX
Author:
eschoysman
See Also:
ExceptionHandle, ConsumerX, FunctionX, PredicateX, SupplierX
